author: pszarzec
body:
## Description
Hello everyone :) 
_This will be my first public entry into the world of open source, so I ask for your understanding._

Using the PowerShell.SDK library (v. 7.0.2) in 3.1.300 dotnet project (C#) I am trying to configure the ADFS. When I try to assign AdfsSamlEndpoint object to existing AdfsRelyingPartyTrust I get an error:
```
Cannot bind parameter 'SamlEndpoint'. Cannot convert the "Microsoft.IdentityServer.Management.Resources.SamlEndpoint" value of type "Deserialized.Microsoft.IdentityServer.Management.Resources.SamlEndpoint" to type "Microsoft.IdentityServer.Management.Resources.SamlEndpoint".
```

**The important thing is that the above commands are called on created session (PS-NewSession) on remote machine:**
```
PSCommand command = new PSCommand();
command.AddCommand("New-PSSession");

// setup: name, hostname, port, username, credentials, ssh file path, SSHTransport=true

powershell.Commands = command;

var session = powershell.Invoke<PSSession>().First();

// relevant command below:
PSCommand command = new PSCommand();
command.AddCommand("Invoke-Command");
command.AddParameter("Session", session);
command.AddParameter("ScriptBlock", ScriptBlock.Create("Set-AdfsRelyingPartyTrust -TargetName {earlier_create_relying_party_trust_name} -SamlEndpoint @(New-AdfsSamlEndpoint -Binding POST -Protocol SAMLAssertionConsumer -Uri {some_url_obj})"));
```
I also tried to assign AdfsSamlEndpoint object to a powershell variable:
``` 
// other content of ScriptBlock.Create("...
$samlEndpoint = New-AdfsSamlEndpoint -Binding POST -Protocol SAMLAssertionConsumer -Uri {some_url_obj};
Set-AdfsRelyingPartyTrust -TargetName {earlier_create_relying_party_trust_name} -SamlEndpoint $samlEndpoint
```

I realize that the problem could arise if I tried to transfer a local variable (AdfsSamlEndpoint object) to a remote session and try to assign it. But creating an object on a remote machine should not serialize anything.

It's very possible that I misunderstood something in the context of using remote powershell sessions :disappointed:

_Edit_
It is possible that, related with: #12907 - I applied all updates from (PowerShell 7 Admin PowerPak for WIndows 10) mentioned by @doctordns 

## Steps to reproduce

```
0. In dotnet 3.1 project
1. Create remote session using `PS-NewSession`.
2. Run `Invoke-Command` cmdlet on that session.
3. Run `Set-AdfsRelyingPartyTrust` with -SamlEndpoint parameter.
```

## Expected behavior

```
Able to create AdfsSamlEndpoint object and adding it to an existing object AdfsRelyingPartyTrust.
```

## Actual behavior

```
Cannot bind parameter 'SamlEndpoint'. 
Cannot convert the "Microsoft.IdentityServer.Management.Resources.SamlEndpoint" value of type "Deserialized.Microsoft.IdentityServer.Management.Resources.SamlEndpoint" to type "Microsoft.IdentityServer.Management.Resources.SamlEndpoint".
```

## Environment data
```
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.0.2
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.0.2
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.18363
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0

dotnet --version
3.1.300
```
